Posts.Content: Hi If you have paid into national Insurance then you should be entitled to contributions based Employment Support Allowance. (ESA). I have been iffworksince last april and my ssp has run out . I still have my job technically but am on no pay with the local authority.  I was awarded esa within 3 days of making the vlaim. Go on direct.gov website to look it up. This should help a bit hopefully. Dont rush back to work if uou are going to struggle. I have been diagnosed with osteoarthritis in my wrists. Not sure what the future holds workwise but driving even makes my wrists hurt let alone working on computers each day. Its taken a bit if pressure off having ESA so do apply its not means tested if its contributions based. Good luck  Samantha
Posts.Title: Being fit and well is such a long way off

Posts.Content: Good luck. Let me know how you get on x
Posts.Title: Being fit and well is such a long way off

Posts.Content: Hi I would suggest getting in touch with healthwatch. They are responsible for looking into all health related treatment concerns. Let them know what's happening and hopefully they will be able to investigate and get you your appointment sorted. Good luck and let us know how you get on x Sammywam
Posts.Title: Cancelled appointment after 4 week wait.

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear the treatment youve been dealt. My drs are fantastic. They have backdated sicknotes for me and signed me off for three months until the end of january while I get to grips with side effects of zoladex etc. I see my gp but for emotional support . I have just been awarded contributions based ESA to as a  paid employee whose sick pay has run out i am entitled to. McMillan siggested I apply. Its really helpful being Christmas to help pay the bills.  Im learning to be kind to myself and not to rush back to work. Listen to your bidy and ask for whwt you need. Speak to mcmillan helpline for advice if you can as they will tell you your legal position. Good luck Samantha
Posts.Title: Angry over sick note

Posts.Content: Hi I do hope thibgs calm down for you soon. I have had zoladex injections for 4 times so far. I have found myself bruising more easily(not sure if this is a side effect).im usually a very emotionsl person and well.up over the silliest things.however strangely as the zoladex is going on.im feeling less emotional but quite diwn and bouts if thinkibg why am I here?, whats it all about?, cant be bothered with anything. I am now having counselling and taking anti depressants as I get very anxious and feel low a lot of the time and.just want to spend time alone, which isn't.like ne at all. Im sorry.your suffering too but relieved in a funny way that you are taking zoladex as I havent.known anyone to take it except me. So hearing yours and others comments makes me deel less alone. Hope things improve for you . All the best  Sammywam
Posts.Title: Over Emotional....

Posts.Content: Hi ive had a double lumpectomy and radiotherapy in may. I still find wearing bras difficult as they are uncomfortable under where I had radio on my right boob. I webt.to m&s and brought two plain post surgery bras. Ive found that they make.my.skin sore under my breast where I had radiotherapy. I think its the ribber ribbing they use as they are not.underwired. went back to using croptops and sports bras. However, Now ive discovered that matalando post op bras and they dont have rhe rubberised bit like m&s. Ones and are prettier. They are suitable for mastectomy too. Worth looking into and cheaper than m&s! Good luck Samantha
Posts.Title: Bras again!

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine So pleased for you. Onwards and upwards ! Samantha
Posts.Title: The results are in!

Posts.Content: Hi I take aromasin exemastane. I have pain in my ribs and my collarbones all the time as well as hip pain and knuckle pain. Im not sure if my.drugs the same.type as yours but I was told by my oncologist that my.rib pain is due to the after effects  of radiotherapy.(I had 15 sessions and 5 booster sessions). I was told there is a thin but strong membrane over our ribs and this can become inflamed and.thats what causes the pain. I have the same worries but my mri was repeated and I got the results last week and they say all is well!  If you've had radiotherapy them it could be similar for you. Good luck and try to stay positive. Sammywam
Posts.Title: Rib Pain - Arimidex

Posts.Content: Hi just little me Your not unusual to feel the way you do. I had dreadful anxiety about returning to work. I have now taken voluntary redundancy. I used to work as an employment advisor for the local authority ironically with adults with disabilities. Taking redundancy and having contributions based ESA awarded has given me the ability to mentally heal. I have counselling, anti depressants and acupuncture to help. It is helping now. (My diagnosis was exactly a year ago) I had a double lumpectomy, radiotherapy and zoladex and exemestane. Im 49. Don't be hard on yourself. You may also be entitled to Employment Support Allowance. Call McMillan as they have a benefits advisory service and can help you understand what you are entitled to whilst recovering. Be kind to yourself. It may be time to re evaluate what you want the future to look.like.  Good luck Sammywam
Posts.Title: Back to work anxiety

Posts.Content: Hi jude I believe that you would be eligible for Enployment Support Allowance (ESA). Depending.on.your circumstances possibly housing benefit and council tax reduction or exemption. You could also ask with your doctors/consultants supporting letters for you to take early retirement on the grounds of disability. As a cancer sufferer you are covered under the equality bill as a disabled person and youe employer needs to consider your circumstances in view of this. You may need to see someone from occupational health who could complete an assessment.if your circumdtances and then make a reccomendation to your employer based onthe outcome of the assessment.  There is also a helpline if you Google the "equality and human rights commision" to help you understand your options.(formerly the disability rights commision) Hope this helps. Im in a similar position only 10 years younger! Samantha
Posts.Title: Giving up work

Posts.Content: Hi I had stage one and a double lumpectomy in May. Im also anxious. I seem to have developed a pain on the top of my right rib under the boob that was operated on too. I will speak to my bc nurse and ask for advice. I also get an aching pain in my back and front and shooting pains still on my surgery boob.  I do feel for you as its difficult to know if the pain is normal or sonething to worry about. I guess if in doubt we both need to get things checked out perhaps. Let me know how you get on ok. Ill update if I get any further advice. Take care Sammywam
Posts.Title: pain in front and back of body

Posts.Content: Hi blossom 38 I didnt feel a pain but slight shooting sensations around my nipple area and one of my.nipples kept popping in and.out. I had no.idea this was a possible symptom.of bc.. felt tired and slightly under par. Went.to see dr thinkibg ir may be the start of menopause as 49 now. She sent me to breaet clinic at my local hospital and they diagnosed two small tumours . One under my nipple and one deep in the tissue. They said I wouldnt have been able to feel the lump. Luckily theyve caught things early. Ive had a double lumpectomy and radiotherapy and now on zoladex and exemastane.  Get checked thoroughly. Mine didnt show up on a mamogram . One showed up on ultrasound and one on.mri scan. Good luck x Samantha
Posts.Title: Breast pain - what would you do?

Posts.Content: Its good to hear im not alone feeling anxious. Ive scoured info but not many.things on here about emotionally coping afterwards. I thought it was just me struggling. Your right. I try each day to look at something positive. I worry about it coming back in the future even though the consultant said hes 95% sure it wont!  My step father died of cancer which plays on my mind even thoygh his was,a different and more aggressive type. Not logical but there you are! Thanks for sharing  Best wishes Samantha O
Posts.Title: Now the treatment is over

Posts.Content: Hi Dolina I am struggling too. I had a double lumpectomy in may this year. Although im physically healing well , emtionally im a mess. I feel anxious all the time. I dont like going out on my own anywhere. It doesnt feel safe but I cant explain why!  Im taking anti depressants to help with the anxiety and mild depression im feeling which I think are helping a bit. Ive started counselling with a mc millan counsellor at my local hospice. She tells me im being too hard on myself. I feel pressure to go back to work but just dont feel able to at the moment. My boss is com i ng to see me with a member of HR on wednesday and I dont really know why or what to say to them. I do enjoy my garden now more than ever and baking cakes etc. Maybe if you can find something that makes uou happy to do then it may lower your anxiety too? Lerp in touch and best wishes Samantha
Posts.Title: Now the treatment is over

Posts.Content: Hi Yes i did thankyou and am printing it off. however I couldnt open any of the links in it.  I do see the sun each day its the future that scares me. Thanks for responding. Samantha
Posts.Title: Now the treatment is over

Posts.Content: Hi interestingly I have pains in both of my collarbones even though I had double lumpectomy on my right boob only. My feet on the soles also hurt to walk on, my hips ache when I get up from sitting (I feel about 100 years old). Both my hands hurt around my wrists and knuckles too.  Im on zoladex and exemastane. I'm on 49. Im taking vitamin D and calcium tablets requested by.my oncologist so I.hope they start helping soon.I have my first year mamogram this week...hope all is ok !  Your post makes me feel reassured as I thought I was imagining it all.  Hope your symptoms improve soon x Sammywam
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: My breast cancer fidnt show up on a mamogram either. Luckily they also did an.ultrasound which showed it up. Then sent.me for an MRI scan which showed a second lump. Dont settle for just a mamogram is my advice.ive only just had surgery in may this year so still very current. I live in Hertfordshire so maybe just lucky they are so thorough! Good luck and hope you stay clear. Samantha
Posts.Title: new hospital procedures for regular check ups

Posts.Content: Hi There seems to be a lot of talk about the physical aspect of your diagnosis by yourself but mainly others here. I think you perhaps maybe could benefit from  some counselling to help you sort your emotions around it all. I struggled more with the emotional than physical aspect. Yet I feel this is the area which doesnt get enough of an airing. Its ok.to be scared and to ask for what makes you feel safe again. I would ask for an MRI if you think it will calm your fears. Anxiety and cancer arent good bedfellows.  I think your right if it feels right to you. I hope this makes sense? Big hug xxx Sammywam
Posts.Title: MRI scan after main treatment

Posts.Content: Hi French I've just been through a similar experience. I was diagnosed with bc in march 2016. I had a double lumpectomy and 20 sessions of radiotherapy. Im currently.on zoladex injections and exemestane tablets etc. I didnt need chemo luckily but my boob is still really sore to.touch. its lumpy around the scar area from the previous surgery. Ive been getting shooting pains in same.breadt and thought i could feel small lumps around my areola. Ive just had an ultrasound and seen the surgeon and.the oncologist and they both say its scar tissue and.the radiotherapy thats making the sensation. Ive been very up and.down with.it all as the fear of it returning never seens to leave me! Good luck and.hope your outcomes similar to mine. Better to be safe than sorry so I'm sure you are doing the right thing xxx
Posts.Title: Lump in breast 2 years after lumpectomy, chemo and radio

Posts.Content: Fantastic news Cheryl. So happy for you. Must male all the chemo worth it !  Samantha
Posts.Title: More Good News...

Posts.Content: Hi  Sorry but I had a double lumpectomy a year ago and still have shooting pains and throbbing etc. I think its part of the territory im afraid.my oncologist said it can take 2 years for a boob to heal after lumpectomy.
Posts.Title: Pain in breast after having a cancer lump removed

Posts.Content: I had a similar story to yours. Some people just dont think before they speak. Take heart that lots of people survive bc and presumably dont get it again. At least thsts wgat im hoping.  It seems to me that unless you have chemo, some unenlightened people dont think cancer is a problem! Keep strong. Sammywam
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: Hi lou Thinking of you. I can only imagine how frightened you are. Lets all hope that you will be strong enough to deal with whatever the results show. If you feel mentally fragile, I urge you to speak to your local hospice for some counselling. This will help you sort your thoughts and worries in a safe, non judgemental space. It can help you cope when with your family. Also see your gp for some anti anxiety tablets. I'm on them and they keep my fears from overwhelming me.  I had bc last year. Still frightened but taken help offered which has given me some decisions I can have control over. This is important when everything else seems out of control for you at the moment I expect. Be kind to yourself and do things that make you happy ok xxxx  Lots of love Samantha
Posts.Title: Scared, I think my breast cancer has gone to my liver....

Posts.Content: Hi Carole Im in a similar boat. I have been.put into menopausal symptoms im 49. I just hope this is it and I don't have to restart the menopause when I stop taking my drugs.  I have regular acupuncture which helps with hot flushes and anxiety. She also puts them in with my achey joints too. I take vitamin d and calcium tablets from the doctor. I also have counselling and try to use meditation to help too.  Check with.your bc nurse before taking any supplements as they can be unhelpful ive been told in relation to other drugs you may be on. Good luck Sammywam
Posts.Title: Can't have HRT so what now?

Posts.Content: Hi When I was only on zoladex my anxiety went through the roof. I now take an anti depressant, have counselling and acupuncture. Hope this helps? Its really helped me.  Maybe ask your local hospice for some help getting this. Good luck sammywam
Posts.Title: More unnecessary tears...

Posts.Content: Lol thats funny. glad you won! we didnt finish the game. had a few beers then went home.
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Yes !!!
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Hi londonlass and all I was diagnosed in may this year. had a double lumpectomy, rads and on zoladex. onco wants to start me on extremastane too. I feel like an alien in my home as nobody else has been through this. soooooo relieved to see im not going mad or Imagining things.im 49 so drugs have put me into menopausal symptoms by stopping my ovaries from working as oestrogen fed c.  I can add to the list huge anxiety, going out into busy places, going back to work (still off)!  Aching body (yesterday diagnosed with osteoarthritis in my wrist) iron deficiency ( taking tablets for this and anxiety/depression, pain relief.) Kids and second husband freezing while im on fire. Funny - went to my daughters graduation at the weekend in Nottingham. went to her flatmates afterwards for games and drinkie poos. I spent most of the evening hanging out of a third floor flat window. it was raining so hair was soaked bit was so hot I had passed caring. her friends were adorable and just kept asking me answers to the game we were playing and avted as if I was completely normal. bless them.
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Ji tarneh No its not a daft question. Im taking zoladex and now just also started exemastane. I've not been offered a bone density scan either! Im 49 and was still having periods regularly. However dur to having threatened bloodclots in the past my.oncologist has decided I shouldn't take tamoxifen due to slight increased risk of thrombosis. I will ask my.oncologist for one when isee him.in 5weeks time as ive already just been.told ive developed osteo arthritis in my wrist. Good luck. Samantha
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?

Posts.Content: Hi Sorry to hear your suffering on tamoxifen. I haven't been given this as I've had suspicion of blood clots in the past. Tamoxifen has a slightly increased risk I was told. Instead I am on zoladex injections every 4 weeks and take exemastane tablets,daily with adcal tablets(vit d and calcium to protect my bones). However I still ache a lot and now have arthritis in my wrists and finger etc. It has put me into.menopausal symptoms as im just 50 and wasn't there as yet. It may be worth asking for this instead.  Good luck Samantha
Posts.Title: Is there an alternative to Tamoxifen?
